description: This 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am 2 Door T-Top  (
Stock # P10311
) is available in our Pleasanton, CA showroom and any inquiries may be directed to us at
or by email at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](
mailto:Sales@SpecialtySales.com
Simply Breathtaking 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am T-Top

New to our Pleasanton showroom is this simply breathtaking 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am 2 Door T-Top with black exterior paint, gold graphics/badging and a black vinyl interior.  Under the hood you’ll find a heavily modified factory 400 cid V-8 engine with the numbers matching automatic transmission, plus this one comes equipped with cold A/C, cruise control, power steering/windows/doors, power brakes, premium wheels and more.
Please note that this classic vehicle is not emissions compliant under California law and it is not eligible to be registered within the state.  Check with your local DMV for further details.
Only 2,000 Total Miles on Factory Rebuilt Drivetrain

In terms of condition, this 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am is well above the typical driver standard with gorgeous paint and an ultra-straight body, a very clean interior and of course the nicely sorted engine compartment.  The engine work was completed within the last 2,000 miles as well so this one sounds like a champion and should have many great years ahead of it.  Everything else on this ’79 Firebird is super-nice- this is one of the most impressive examples we’ve seen in quite some time.

While this beauty is still technically a numbers-matching classic, you can see from the photographs that extensive work has been done to the engine.  We do not have any DYNO testing on file so we don’t know how much power it’s putting out at the wheels, but we can tell you that it’s very quick and a great overall muscle car.  It does everything well with a great feel on the open road.
Fantastic Overall Condition Both Inside & Out

Overall, you’ll find that this 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am T-Top is in investment grade condition and ready to enjoy immediately by a performance enthusiast.  With recent interest in this model recently topping an all-time high, now would be the perfect time to add this spectacular muscle car to your collection.  For more information about this vehicle, visit our Pleasanton, California showroom, give us a call at
, or email us at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](

title: 1972 Pontiac Firebird

description: For sale in our Atlanta showroom is a real deal Y84, Smokey and the Bandit edition, 1979 Pontiac Trans Am. This bad boy is everything you'd expect from a car that's been known as the staple car of late 70s muscle. The gorgeous lines, Black paint, and classic Phoenix sprawled across the hood stirs up so much nostalgia and emotion, being in its mere presence will cause you to feel your mustache growing in! With the T-tops off, this '79 Pontiac Trans Am for sale is your getaway car. Powering this beastly Y84 Trans Am for sale is a 400 cubic inch Pontiac V8 engine. The epic 6.6L engine has a sound that gives many GM enthusiasts goosebumps and is sure to make you grin with joy, especially when backed by a 4-speed manual transmission. Power brakes, power steering, V8, stick shift... Does it get any better than this? This 1979 Pontiac Trans-Am for sale is a true representation of late 70s muscle cars! The shaker hood rumbles at the tap of the throttle and begs you to let the beast within loose. The aftermarket snowflake wheels are a staple of classic Pontiacs and can be found on this gorgeously restored T/A. Add this to the sporty and sharp lines of the Firebird and you have a car with looks that could kill! The interior is vintage style, with Black cloth interior. The black sport buckets up front comfortably straddle the center console and 4-speed shifter, while the back bench seat invites passengers to sit down, strap in, and hold on for the ride! This car is so vintage, it even sports the factory prism style dash! Options on this 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am for sale, include: AM/FM radio, cassette, power brakes, power steering, seat belts, cloth interior, and aluminum/alloy wheels wrapped in radial tires. Now is your chance to grab one of the quickest rising valued cars in the market! This Y84 1979 Pontiac Trans-Am for sale stands out from the rest and is ready to be the street cruiser or street bruiser you want it to be. To view the car in greater detail, including 100+ HD photos and HD video, please visit www.gatewayclassiccars.com. For more information please call the Atlanta showroom at 678-894-4833 or e-mail us at Atlanta@GatewayClassicCars.com.

description: For sale in our Fort Lauderdale showroom is a 1979 Pontiac Trans Am Bandit Edition. This 1979 Trans Am special edition is just one of 360 produced with a 4.9L 301cid V8 engine, WS6, and T-tops. T-tops in many years of production are notorious for leaks. This Trans Am, however, has no leaks whatsoever! A true legend, this car features the firebird on the hood. This car was in a museum for some of its years, and for good reason. This Trans Am has had very light use with only 15,379 pampered miles. This Matching numbers Pontiac has an all original engine, save for the battery. This stunning example has been documented by Pontiac Historic Services. This car has a 100% original camel hobnail interior except for the headliner. The Trans Am comes with its window sticker, car cover, and original books and history. The sale of this Trans Am even includes a replica of the BanditÃ¢??s hat and SallyÃ¢??s wedding dress! If you want a piece of automotive history, then youÃ¢??ve found it. Get your bandit today! Located in our Fort Lauderdale, this 1979 Pontiac Trans Am can be seen in greater detail including over 100 pictures, and an HD video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com. For immediate assistance please call 954-227-4202 or email FortLauderdale@GatewayClassicCars.com
title: 1979 Pontiac Firebird

description: Not only is the arguably one of the best years for the Firebird, but you're looking at a numbers-matching V8 coupe with some fun upgrades.  So the value price only adds to this unique 1974 Pontiac Firebird.

1974 is the last of the early second-generation Firebirds. In 1975 the wrap-around rear window would debut, and there are many who still feel that the full fastback b-pillars of the '74s are the best-looking of the bunch.   We love these classic Pontiacs because the Endura plastic front ends gave them a unique and muscular appearance, and today it's important to find examples that still look as good as this one.  The black is a professional application that takes advantage of modern paint practices.  The result is a finish quality that will make you swear they make black mirrors.  It also helps that the swoopy design on the '74 remains intact on this superior sheetmetal.  We could continue to tell you how good the body is, but all you have to do is feel how well the doors still shut to understand how well this one has been cared for.   The factory honeycomb wheels look fantastic, but it's not the only piece that grabs the attention.  Those bold twin air scoops in front are always great to see, and the upgrade to a Ram Air hood is more than just cosmetic.

If you like the slick black exterior, than the condition of the slick black vinyl interior will impress you, too.  The bucket seats, door panels, floor mats, and comfortable center console all have a deep black premium appearance.  But this is more than just a sea of darkness.  The bright trim around the console gearshift and the original AM radio, as well as on the three-spoke factory wheel all brighten up this interior.  Plus, the wood paneling surrounding the factory gauges does a nice job of warming up the whole atmosphere.

The 350 cubic-inch, four-barrel V8 is the correct numbers-matching powerplant for this Firebird.  By now you've realized that this is not a factory Formula car.  Instead, this one strikes a nice balance by offering the original V8, while also making one of the coolest upgrades actually function.  After all, some people upgrade the hood, but very few people also top the motor with the right air grabber to make the whole package work. That means a V8 with prominence and extra power.  Beyond the upgrade, the engine bay looks quite tidy with the correct blue one the block and everything looking well maintained â€“ from the hoses to the brake master cylinder.  Out on the road this enhanced power V8 is matched with a three-speed automatic transmission, power steering, and front disc brakes to be a great driving classic.
This car has a unique and terrific appearance that looks like you paid far more than the affordable list price.  We'll even keep this Firebird's secret for you at no extra cost!  Call now!!
title: 1974 Pontiac Firebird

description: Little did Pontiac know when they created the Trans Am in 1969 they would be creating one of those cars that would set people's hearts racing for several decades and the late 70s TAs where some of the last hold outs of the original Muscle Car era.  Although they admittedly weren't as muscular as their predecessors, they did kick butt on the other competition of the day.  With a great balance of horse power, driving manners, and creature comforts they help to usher in the era of Modern Muscle Cars so prevalent today.  Add to that the larger than life personality of Burt Reynolds and the wholesome sex appeal of Sally Field and well the rest is movie history.  With the disappointing demise of the Pontiac mark from the GM banner these great looking and fun to drive Trans Ams are becoming the next generation of highly desirable collector cars.  Don't miss out on your chance to own one before the market gets so heated up that you will tell your grandkids I had a chance to own one of those once, but I balked and walked.
title: 1978 Pontiac Firebird

description: Here is a ultra rare and unique car. This is a 1976 Pontiac Trans Am 50th Anniversary Edition car with a 455 motor and 4-speed manual transmission.

This car is a 50th Anniversary model of Pontiac. It has the factory gold package. It came with a factory 455 engine that has been rebuilt but has never been fired over since then. This was the last year that they offered the 455 in these cars from the factory. This is the first model of the Y-84 or "declared" cars that they made. Most came with factory Hurst T-Tops but some did not and this is one of them.

The body on this car is very straight and clean. There is No rust on this car. There is two spots on the roof where the paint peeled and there is surface rust but nothing major. There is no dents on the car. This car is in very little need of restoration especially on the outside.

The interior of this car is actually in pretty good shape. It has the black seats with the red trim. The front seats do show some wear but the back seats are in great shape. The carpet is all still here and looks great. The headliner is beautiful. It has the dark gold on the steering wheel and the matching gold trim on the dash. This was all part of the special package. This car even came with Factory A/C.

If you are looking for an ultra rare car to start or add to a collection. Or something you don't have to do much work on at all this is the car for you. This is one of the most rare cars I own and really don't want to sell it but I am selling just about everything and it just needs to go.
Once again this is a 76' Pontiac Trans Am 50th Anniversary Y84 Edition Car. With factory 455 that has been rebuilt and 4-Speed manual transmission. Also has the gold package and factory A/C

I took pictures of every detail of this car so you can get the full picture and know exactly what you are getting. If there is any other questions or any other pictures you would like please let us know.
Options:
50th Anniversary Edition
Ultra Rare
4-Speed Manual Transmission
Gold Package
Factory A/C
Current Mileage:    66,266 (5-Digit Odometer)
Vehicle Disclosures of Condition:

Surface rust spots on the roof. Front seats show some wear. Factory radio is missing. Motor was rebuilt and never fired after that. Some scrapes and paint fading on bumpers. This car has been sitting awhile and is gonna take some tinkering to get running. Never know could need a hose or belt at any time. This is a non running project car that is in need of restoration. The car does not come with the wheels and tires that are in the pictures. The car was a runner but has been sitting for awhile and not sure what it would take to get it running. This is a classic car that does need some restoration. Everything is pictured and in the video.
title: 1976 Pontiac Firebird

title: 1973 Pontiac Firebird

description: When GM introduced the F body in 1967 the Chevy Camaro got all the fanfare because it sold more than it's cousin the Firebird.  But for anyone who knew how to navigate the order form you could get all the performance of a similar Chevy but with the upgraded trim that Pontiac offered in the day.  This particular Firebird is powered by a legendary 400 CID big block.  Being a Resto Mod it is not 100% original but you will not find a nicer driver for this kind of money.  Take this chance to enjoy this superb running solid Arizona Firebird at a fraction of the cost of restoration.
title: 1969 Pontiac Firebird

description: For sale in our Dallas showroom is an example of the epitome of 70Ã¢??s automotive icons. This 1977 Pontiac Firebird is a great one. Highly modified drivetrain but stock interior and exterior with one exception. The Year One 17Ã¢?Â aluminum snowflake wheels. So letÃ¢??s start with the fun stuff. The engine is a Pontiac 455 that has been massaged, punched out, and polished into a fire breathing 474 CID Pontiac V8 Stroker with Eagle forged pistons and rods, a Butler forged steel crankshaft. The camshaft is a Howards hydraulic roller camshaft and there are also Howards lifters and springs. The cylinder heads are Pontiac 7K3 Heads that were ported and polished for maximum flow. The long block is topped off with an Edelbrock intake manifold and MSD ignition system. The exhaust starts with DougÃ¢??s ceramic coated headers and exits through custom exhaust. All this has to be backed by a strong transmission, well that is the case here a Bowtie OverdriveÃ¢??s 2004R 4 speed automatic transmission. And finally the rear end is a Moser 10 bolt with 3.73:1 gears. Handling was not forgotten with a Hotchkis lowering kit and sways bars, Lakewood Traction Bars and 6 leaf rear springs. Finally the body, paint and body was done by Elmos Pontiac in Monett, MO and the Graphics are Ã¢??Platinum BanditÃ¢?Â for a different take on the Ã¢??BanditÃ¢?Â Trans Am. This is one of the coolest Firebirds we have come across in a while and is ready to roll. The features include Power Brakes, Power Steering, Tilt Wheel, Seat Belts, Vinyl Interior, Radial Tires, and Aluminum Alloy Wheels. For more HD pictures and video visit http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/dallas/1977/pontiac/firebird-S383.html. For more information call our Dallas showroom at 817-310-9400.
title: 1977 Pontiac Firebird
